author: abdel.stark
content: Ok great. Yeah that's what I meant by stack. I think that's fine if we have 2 different spamming tools in 2 different languages.  Or you could contribute to the Rust spammer if you prefer, just take whatever you are more comfortable with. And this is a good thing that you plan to add observability tools and profiling, this will be very helpful.I hope you are doing better now and that you totally recovered from Covid, take care mate.

author: abdel.stark
content:
I also forked blob-utils of <@159152274659082240> to add a test file to generate some test vectors in case you need more scenarios: https://github.com/abdelhamidbakhta/blob-utils/tree/feature/test-vectors
To generate new test vectors you can simply add test cases and run:
```bash
go test
```
It will generate new JSON file under `/tmp/eip4844_test_vectors.json`

author: abdel.stark
content: Btw <@552133098075193354> that makes me think that the effort regarding reference tests should start sooner rather than later, it will simplify onboarding new EL and CL teams to work on their implementation. What do you think ?

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> > <timbeiko>  yep, that's definitely something w'e've been blocked on, at least on the EL side. On the CL, I think Danny and others have started writing spec tests? (re @sharded_data_bot: <Abdel | StarkWare> Btw <@552133098075193354> that makes me think that the effort regarding reference tests should start sooner rather than later, it will simplify onboarding new EL and CL teams to work on their implementation. What do you think ?)

author: bridge-bot
content: <timbeiko> That said, there are stil open PRs to the spec, so it might be worth resolving those first, or at least starting with coverage of areas unchanged by those
